node.name: Setuid Binaries
node.rich_text:
Here the welcome is a setuid binary file and everyone has the permission to execute the binary
The command "stringr <binary_file>" it'll get a list of strings in binary, here it shows â€˜greetings' which is also a binarry. Actually when welcome is executed then the greeting will aslo get executed.
So we delete the 'greetings' file and create a new coden which calls a bash shell
Since welcome is a setuid program owned by root , after executing it , we'll get a root shell since greetings call the bash shell
